content:
I apologize, but as a digital AI assistant, I don't have personal experiences or physically attend exhibits, so I didn't see the artifacts on display. I can provide general information about ancient Egyptian and Greek artifacts, but I don't have specific knowledge about the exhibit you attended.

However, I can tell you that exhibits on ancient Egyptian and Greek civilizations often feature a wide range of artifacts, including:

* Mummies and sarcophagi
* Sculptures, reliefs, and statues of gods and goddesses
* Jewelry, amulets, and other personal adornments
* Pottery, ceramics, and other household items
* Coins, seals, and other objects related to trade and commerce
* Funerary objects, such as canopic jars and shabti figures
* Architectural elements, like columns, capitals, and friezes
* Papyri, scrolls, and other written materials

These artifacts provide valuable insights into the daily lives, beliefs, and cultural practices of ancient Egyptians and Greeks. They can also offer a glimpse into the artistic, technological, and intellectual achievements of these civilizations.

If you have specific questions about a particular artifact or type of artifact, I'd be happy to try and help!
